I didn't follow him much at OKC but he's been good at identifying each player's strengths and weaknesses and making gameplays according to them. Sounds basic but  here are some changes I saw over these 30 games  1) Lavine's improved shot selection, defence and off ball movement. Lavine is getting better as a defender, active hands and getting over screens well. Sometimes doesn't come as help quick enough but he's learning. He's been given the green light to take mid-range jumpers and he's making them, his 3pt shots have been a healthy mix of catch and shoots and off the dribble  2) Thad young's role as a bench facilitator and post player. Boylen made Thad a spot up shooter but Billy's usage of Thad has been excellent. He's running plays through Thad, where he finds cutters or executes dribble handoffs. If all of those fail, he has enough skill to make his own shot by posting up and jump hooks.   3) Drop coverage defence. We used to get destroyed by pick and rolls earlier in this season due to our centers dropping too deep. Now the guards are fighting hard over the screens and the centers aren't dropping much  making it difficult for the opposition guards to make a decision and this has been helping us a bit.   4) Ball movement has improved a lot, helping us create a lot of open looks for Coby White, Lauri , Temple and Patrick Williams, whose 3pt shooting %s have all improved from last season.   Really excited to watch bulls games as we seem to be making adjustments every game and coming out with a gameplan unlike last season .

Wendell seemed like a pretty solid defender, if a little small, and Vuc was seen as a horrible defender.
